title: DIY Gift Wrapping! Ideas to Wrap a Present (8 Creative Techniques, Styles)

json.text: Hey!

World is getting ready for Christmas, but
presents are not popular just this time of
the year - we all have birthdays.

That's why I want to share a lot of cool and
unexpected gift wrapping ideas with you, which
will surely impress all your friends and familly.

So take your crafty spirits out and let's
wrap some gifts.

Let's begin with 3 unique gift wrapping ideas,
where you just need a white paper, while everything
else you probably already have at home.

For the first present you need a white gift
wrapping paper, tape, scissors, colored cardboard
for the card, elastics, lollipops, and a ruler.

Take your white gift wrapping paper or just
a regular white paper and cut out a piece
big enough to wrap your gift.

It's amazing how many different gift wrappings
you can make with a white paper and some imagination.

Just take a look around your room and you
will surely find many ideas on how to decorate
this plain present.

I found some colorful elastics which can easily
replace the usually used ribbon.

Bind the elastics by making a knot like this
until your string of elastics is long enough.

Luckily my elastics are quite long by default
so my string is growing pretty fast.

Wrap the elastic around the present the same
way as you would by using a normal ribbon.

Make a knot on top and you can already finish
here.

Or, you can tie on some lollipops to add some
extra sweetness to the present.

Now, I am going to show you how to quickly
make a little gift card, on which you can
write the name of the recipient.

Cut two rectangles from colored paper or cardboard,
where one must be slightly smaller than the
other.

It looks really nice if you choose two similar
colors to the colors of the elastics.
I chose yellow and blue.

Glue the cardboard rectangles together to
get the card!

And here it is, our unique present, that everyone
would be happy to receive, but candy lovers
especially.

To decorate our next plain white package we
will use some colorful balloons.
Tie balloons together like so.

As you can see I've used the longer balloons
in the middle and the normal rounded ones
at the ends of my balloon string.

The rounded balloons will make a beautiful
bow on top of the package.

So just wrap the string around the present
in the same way as before with the elastics.
I think this present looks absolutely adorable.

Maybe it is more appropriate for children,
but I would be super happy to receive a gift
wrapped in such way too!
You can also add a card.

By coincidence, this one that I used on the
previous gift fits perfectly with this one
as well.

The third technique on how to spice up a boring
white present is by using paper clips.

I am using yellow and violet clips today,
but you can use normal silver or gold ones.

They would look especially cool on a black
wrapping paper.

Bind the clips together like so and when your
paper clips strand is long enough, wrap it
around the present and connect it on top.

Start adding paper clips to the top where
the clip string crosses until you end up with
a lovely flower.
How cool and special is this present, right?

As you have seen, you can decorate your plain
white packages in so many unique ways, and

the best of all is that you don't need to
buy anything, simply use small things you
can find lying around your home.

To me it seems very thoughtful if you personalize
a gift wrapping for the person the present
is for.

If that person is someone that really likes
music, plays an instrument or is a singer
-- why not wrapping the gift in a music sheet?!

Here I'll also show how you can use a yarn
instead of a ribbon to decorate your present.
First, I've printed out a music sheet.
Mine is for a jingle bells song, how appropriate.

If you're a musician and have some music sheets
that you don't need any more, you can of course
use those to wrap the package.

To add some extra cuteness to the present,
we're going to make a pom-pom.

You need a yarn and some thread in the same
color.

Wrap the yarn around three fingers approximately
40 times.

If you want your pom-pom to be bigger, use
4 fingers, if you want a very small pom pom,
2 fingers are enough.

Take the yarn off your fingers and tie some
thread around it like so to get a bow shape.

Cut through the loops on both sides and then
style your pom pom into a nice rounded ball
using scissors.
Place it on the top of your package.

You can just glue it down or you can tie it
on with some more yarn like me.

I used two pieces of yarn to wrap them around
the pom pom first and then I tied the ends
at the bottom of the package.
How super-duper cute is this gift wrapping!

You can also use two or three pom-poms together,
maybe use different colors of yarn for each
and it will look perfect.
Trust me with that!

Pom poms are not the only way to use yarn
when wrapping gifts.

Here I am using 4 colors of yarn to dress
up this little brown box.

Wrap the yarn around the present and leave
about 10 centimeters or 4 inches extra yarn
on each side.

So now cut more pieces of yarn in different
colors.

Pull all the yarn pieces together and tie
them on top of your package.
Cut away the excess yarn and you're done.
So quick and simple yet so lovely.

Are you giving a present to someone that really
loves cooking and baking?
Use cupcake liners to jazz it up!

Well, even if the person is not a baking lover,
this unique idea will surely impress everyone.

You need a ribbon, cupcake liners, thread
and a needle, scissors and a hot glue gun
or just a regular glue for this one.
Start by separating the cupcake liners.

Put approximately 6 liners one into another
and then scrunch the top three or four of
them.

The bottom ones must remain in a nice rounded
shape.

Sew the cupcake liners together with the needle
and some thread, make two knots at the bottom
to secure them.

Now it's time to add some more liners in the
middle to perfect the shape of our cupcake
flower.
Scrunch the extra liners strongly like me.

Note that you only want to scrunch or pull
together the bottom of each cupcake liner.

Apply some hot glue to the middle of the cupcake
flower and stick them in.
And tada here's our cute flower finished.

Wrap a ribbon around the present, secure it
on top with some glue and while the glue is
still hot, place the cupcake flower on top.
I love this cupcake flower idea!

This one would be perfect for my mom, because
she loves baking. and I love eating her specialties.

But let's leave my guilty pleasures; we still
have two gift wrapping styles to go!

The first is perfect for your grandparents,
uncles and aunts or other grown-ups.

It incorporates some fabric, tree twigs and
some raffia ribbon.

Start off by distressing the longer sides
of the fabric a bit, which will give the present
a softer look.

To do that, just pull out some horizontal
threads.

Wrap the fabric around the package like this
and glue the ends together.

Place some tree twigs on top and wrap the
raffia ribbon around to tie them to the package.

You can use some pine tree twigs too! the
green would look beautiful on the red fabric
resulting in a perfect Christmas present.

While mine twig selection works great for
a birthday present at any time of the year.

The last gift wrapping idea is perfect for
Christmas.
Obviously.

To make the Santa gift wrap you need some
red fabric, cotton wool, glue and scissors.

First cut a triangle from the fabric for his
hat.

To cut a nice looking triangle, fold the corner
of the fabric like this and trace these two

lines -- you'll end up with a perfect symmetric
triangle in no time.

Next, take the cotton wool, tear it into small
pieces and form them into little balls.

Glue a row of cotton balls to the bottom part
of the Santa's hat.

If you want to add your Santa some eyes, cut
two bigger ovals from white paper and two
smaller circles from the black one.

Stick them to the middle, on the bottom edge
of the hat.

And there would be no Santa without his signature
white beard.

So let's quickly make it by gluing the cotton
balls to the package.
Leave some space empty to represent his smile.
Lastly, add a big pom-pom on top of his hat.
And there you have it.
It doesn't really get any cuter than this!

By wrapping a gift in a unique way you tell
the person how special he or she is to you.

This person will definitely appreciate your
creativity and the time you took to make something
different and unexpected.

Will you use any of these techniques to wrap
the presents for your loved ones?

Thank you so much for all your love on my
DIY beanie tutorial, it made me really happy

to see all your awesome comments, likes and
shares.

Please be so nice to this video as well and
I may film more crazy gift wrapping ideas.
See you soon!
Ho Ho Ho Merry Christmas, Ho Ho Ho Ho!
